Medicine_tweet_150_r.News Finding: Diet rich in omega 3 (best source = oily fish) could help preserve pancreatic function for kids with T1 #diabetes
Medicine_tweet_150_r.Paper Finding: Our study suggests that long-chain omega-3 fatty acids may provide protection to the b-cell after clinical diagnosis of type 1 diabetes.
Medicine_tweet_150_r.News Context: Diet rich in omega 3 (best source = oily fish) could help preserve pancreatic function for kids with T1 #diabetes
Medicine_tweet_150_r.Paper Context: However, significantly reduced risk of development of islet autoimmunity was associated with increased intake of omega-3 fatty acids among youth genetically susceptible to development of type 1 diabetes (36), although continued follow-up did not reveal subsequent protection against incident type 1 diabetes (37). Our study suggests that long-chain omega-3 fatty acids may provide protection to the b-cell after clinical diagnosis of type 1 diabetes. Our results support further study of the potential role of branched-chain amino acids to enhance sustained insulin production in type 1 diabetes.
Medicine_tweet_150_r.text: ['Finding: Diet rich in omega 3 (best source = oily fish) could help preserve pancreatic function for kids with T1 #diabetes ']
Medicine_tweet_150_r.displayed_text: Finding: Diet rich in omega 3 (best source = oily fish) could help preserve pancreatic function for kids with T1 #diabetes

Medicine_tweet_53_p.News Finding: stat. meth in Swedish trials has led to overestimat of risk reduction in breast cancer death due to mammo screening.
Medicine_tweet_53_p.Paper Finding: Our re-calculations of Swedish trial revealed that risks of breast cancer death were similar for cancers found during the intervention and the post-intervention periods, indicating that reductions in the risk of breast cancer death also applied to cancer cases diagnosed when screening (or absence of screening) was the same in both screening and control groups.
Medicine_tweet_53_p.News Context: stat. meth in Swedish trials has led to overestimat of risk reduction in breast cancer death due to mammo screening.
Medicine_tweet_53_p.Paper Context: The compensation argument invoked by Swedish trial investigators 6, is thus not tenable. Our re-calculations of Swedish trial revealed that risks of breast cancer death were similar for cancers found during the intervention and the post-intervention periods, indicating that reductions in the risk of breast cancer death also applied to cancer cases diagnosed when screening (or absence of screening) was the same in both screening and control groups. Such result is compatible with an effect of being allocated to the screening or to the control group on the risk of breast cancer death (allocation effect), but not with an effect of mammography screening (screening effect) on that risk.
Medicine_tweet_53_p.text: ['Finding: Our re-calculations of Swedish trial revealed that risks of breast cancer death were similar for cancers found during the intervention and the post-intervention periods, indicating that reductions in the risk of breast cancer death also applied to cancer cases diagnosed when screening (or absence of screening) was the same in both screening and control groups.']
Medicine_tweet_53_p.displayed_text: Finding: Our re-calculations of Swedish trial revealed that risks of breast cancer death were similar for cancers found during the intervention and the post-intervention periods, indicating that reductions in the risk of breast cancer death also applied to cancer cases diagnosed when screening (or absence of screening) was the same in both screening and control groups.

Medicine_tweet_170_r.News Finding: Abstract: Teens who regularly use synthetic cannabinoids more likely 2 report polydrug use than marijuana-only users
Medicine_tweet_170_r.Paper Finding: Marijuana users who use other drugs in particular are at highest risk for currently using SCs, so particular focus needs to be paid to these individuals at high risk.
Medicine_tweet_170_r.News Context: Abstract: Teens who regularly use synthetic cannabinoids more likely 2 report polydrug use than marijuana-only users
Medicine_tweet_170_r.Paper Context: Although previous studies have revealed that marijuana users are at high risk for use, this study revealed risk factors among current marijuana users that increase risk of current use and higher-frequency use of SCs. Prevention needs to be focused primarily on marijuana users, especially marijuana users with risk factors discovered in this analysis. Marijuana users who use other drugs in particular are at highest risk for currently using SCs, so particular focus needs to be paid to these individuals at high risk.
Medicine_tweet_170_r.text: ['Finding: Abstract: Teens who regularly use synthetic cannabinoids more likely 2 report polydrug use than marijuana-only users ']
Medicine_tweet_170_r.displayed_text: Finding: Abstract: Teens who regularly use synthetic cannabinoids more likely 2 report polydrug use than marijuana-only users

Medicine_283_r.News Finding: Circuit training is also a great way to improve your muscular endurance and strength.
Medicine_283_r.Paper Finding: In conclusion, I observed how circuit training at home can improve the calcaneus QUS status, such as QUS-SI, QUS-SOS, and QUS-BUA, as well as build muscle while losing fat mass through easy sports activities among young females.
Medicine_283_r.News Context:
The benefits of circuit training

When it comes down to it, the benefits of circuit training are to burn fat and build muscle, Ryan says. Circuit training is also a great way to improve your muscular endurance and strength. Circuit training helps with building muscular endurance because there aren't any rests between exercises; you go from one move to the next.
Medicine_283_r.Paper Context: Third, studies involving both sexes may be needed to clarify the sex-based differences in the effect of such exercise on the calcaneus QUS status. In conclusion, I observed how circuit training at home can improve the calcaneus QUS status, such as QUS-SI, QUS-SOS, and QUS-BUA, as well as build muscle while losing fat mass through easy sports activities among young females. These findings suggest that circuit training can help females attain significantly greater bone mass and muscle mass and may reduce their risk of osteoporosis or cardiovascular disease in later life.
Medicine_283_r.text: ['Finding: Circuit training is also a great way to improve your muscular endurance and strength.']
Medicine_283_r.displayed_text: Finding: Circuit training is also a great way to improve your muscular endurance and strength.

Medicine_350_r.News Finding: They say their findings could lead to new ways to identify people at high risk for Alzheimer's.
Medicine_350_r.Paper Finding: In contrast, a smaller population-based cohort of 812 in three French cities showed substantially increased dementia risk (odds ratio 3.9, [1.5, 10.4]) in participants with glaucoma during 3 years, but only analyzed 2436 person-years, roughly 1/6 of our follow-up .
Medicine_350_r.News Context: They say their findings could lead to new ways to identify people at high risk for Alzheimer's. "The main message from this study is that ophthalmologists should be more aware of the risks of developing dementia for people with these eye conditions and primary care doctors seeing patients with these eye conditions might be more careful on checking on possible dementia or memory loss," Lee explained in a university news release. Patients with age-related macular degeneration, diabetic retinopathy or glaucoma had a 40 to 50 percent greater risk of Alzheimer's disease than those without the eye conditions, the researchers said.
Medicine_350_r.Paper Context: Similarly, a retrospective study using 5% of Medicare claims data revealed no increased AD risk in people with glaucoma (n 5 63,235) compared with propensity score-matched people without glaucoma during 14 years of follow-up (HR 0.91, [0.88, 0.93]) . In contrast, a smaller population-based cohort of 812 in three French cities showed substantially increased dementia risk (odds ratio 3.9, [1.5, 10.4]) in participants with glaucoma during 3 years, but only analyzed 2436 person-years, roughly 1/6 of our follow-up . The Rotterdam Study followed 1438 dementia-free participants aged 75 years for an average of 25 months and found increased AD risk in those with advanced AMD (HR 2.1, [1.1, 4.3] ), but this became insignificant with smoking and atherosclerosis included in the model .
Medicine_350_r.text: ['Finding: They say their findings could lead to new ways to identify people at high risk for Alzheimer\'s.']
Medicine_350_r.displayed_text: Finding: They say their findings could lead to new ways to identify people at high risk for Alzheimer's.

Medicine_tweet_66_r.News Finding: Excited to have our new @username study out in @username showing use of video visits for #telehealth has increased dramatically in the U.S. (from 6.6% in 2013 to 21.6% in 2016); however, use lowest for Medicaid, low income and rural populations.
Medicine_tweet_66_r.Paper Finding: The use of telehealth increased dramatically in the period 2013-16 across all population groups.
Medicine_tweet_66_r.News Context: Excited to have our new @username study out in @username showing use of video visits for #telehealth has increased dramatically in the U.S. (from 6.6% in 2013 to 21.6% in 2016); however, use lowest for Medicaid, low income and rural populations.
Medicine_tweet_66_r.Paper Context: [31] Demonstrating the role that telehealth can play in achieving the Triple Aim of improving quality and health outcomes while lowering the cost of care could prove to be a powerful incentive for increased uptake. The use of telehealth increased dramatically in the period 2013-16 across all population groups. While we found evidence that populations with limited mobility (such as Medicare beneficiaries younger than age sixty-five and people with selfreported physical or mental health concerns that limit their activities) were among the highest users, key underserved populations (including Medicaid, low-income, and rural populations) had significantly lower use of telehealth.
Medicine_tweet_66_r.text: ['Finding: Excited to have our new @username study out in @username showing use of video visits for #telehealth has increased dramatically in the U.S. (from 6.6% in 2013 to 21.6% in 2016); however, use lowest for Medicaid, low income and rural populations. ']

Medicine_tweet_27_r.News Finding: Amygdala encodes subjective judgment of emotions shown in face stimuli, rather than simply their stimulus features:
Medicine_tweet_27_r.Paper Finding: This suggests that amygdala neurons encode whole-face information and emotion independently.
Medicine_tweet_27_r.News Context: Amygdala encodes subjective judgment of emotions shown in face stimuli, rather than simply their stimulus features:
Medicine_tweet_27_r.Paper Context: We found 3 out of 24 (12.5%) fear-selective cells and 5 out of 17 (29.4%) happyselective cells are also whole-face-selective, a ratio of whole-face cells similar to that found in the entire population (36 out of 185, 19.5%). This suggests that amygdala neurons encode whole-face information and emotion independently. We found that face information conveyed by the eyes, but not the mouth region, modulated emotion-selective neuronal responses.
Medicine_tweet_27_r.text: ['Finding: Amygdala encodes subjective judgment of emotions shown in face stimuli, rather than simply their stimulus features: ']
Medicine_tweet_27_r.displayed_text: Finding: Amygdala encodes subjective judgment of emotions shown in face stimuli, rather than simply their stimulus features:
